thread.title: AUS vs IND: Fans blast Anushka Sharma as Virat Kohli registers successive ducks for the first time in ODI career
thread.title_full: AUS vs IND: Fans blast Anushka Sharma as Virat Kohli registers successive ducks for the first time in ODI career

author: @CricketTimesHQ
title: AUS vs IND: Fans blast Anushka Sharma as Virat Kohli registers successive ducks for the first time in ODI career
text:
The second ODI against Australia delivered a shocking, unwanted first for Indian cricket as superstar batter Virat Kohli registered successive ducks in the ODI format, falling for a four-ball duck in Adelaide after his first-ever ODI duck Down Under in Perth. This unprecedented slump instantly sent shockwaves through the fan base, raising alarm bells over the batting maestroâ€™s sudden dip in form and his troubles against the new ball.
While the cricketing world debated his technique against Mitchell Marshâ€˜s Australia, a darker side of the internet swiftly emerged. As has become a reprehensible and shameful pattern, social media trolls mercilessly targeted his wife, actress Anushka Sharma, subjecting her to brutal, baseless abuse and blaming her for his on-field struggles. The unfortunate dismissals reignited the toxic narrative, forcing the couple yet again to confront an onslaught of unwarranted criticism from a cruel section of the online community.
AUS vs IND, 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli registers historic ducks down under
The dual failure of Kohli in the ongoing ODI series against Australia has become a massive talking point, not just for the runs he failed to score but for the unfortunate cricketing history he now holds. The 2nd ODI at the Adelaide Oval saw Kohli depart for a four-ball duck, trapped leg before wicket by the impressive young Australian pacer Xavier Bartlett.
This followed his earlier duck in the series opener in Perth, marking the first time in his illustrious ODI career that the batting icon has been dismissed for ducks in successive innings. This sequence of dismissals is exceptionally rare for a player of his calibre, underscoring the momentary lapse in form against a dominant Australian bowling attack. Bartlett, who came into the side in place of Nathan Ellis, proved immediately effective.
After the visitors were reduced to 17/0 in six overs, following the dismissal of Indian captain Shubman Gill, Bartlett tested the former skipper expertly. On the final ball of the over, Kohli was caught plumb in front, a decision he accepted without review, walking off in disappointment.
Despite these two recent blips, Kohliâ€™s career average stands at a magnificent 57.41 in ODI cricket. In 304 matches, the Indian batter owns a staggering 14,181 runs with a strike rate of 93.27, including a record 51 centuries in the format, demonstrating that the current setback is merely a minuscule anomaly in an otherwise gigantic, flawless career. However, the momentary vulnerability in his game has given critics and trolls a temporary, if misplaced, reason to attack.
Trolls blame Anushka Sharma for Kohliâ€™s poor form
In a disturbing repetition of history, the moment Kohli registered his successive ducks, the focus of toxic social media discourse shifted immediately and unfairly to his wife, Bollywood actress Anushka. This practice of blaming the cricketerâ€™s wife or partner for his poor performance has been a persistent and dark stain on cricket fandom for years. Trolls flooded platforms with vile memes and comments, reviving the misogynistic narrative that Anushka is a â€˜bad omenâ€™ or unlucky charm, directly correlating her presence or influence with Kohliâ€™s failure to score.
This deeply entrenched pattern ignores the fundamental realities of professional sports, that a playerâ€™s performance is dictated by skill, form, and match conditions, not the presence of a family member. High-profile setbacks, like a rare successive duck, seem to act as a trigger for this online abuse, creating a public spectacle where the actress is scapegoated for technical failures on the field. This cruel trolling occurs despite Kohli himself having repeatedly spoken out against such behaviour in the past, publicly defending Anushka and urging fans to show compassion.
Hereâ€™s how fans reacted:
